name: palazzo
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a very large and beautiful Italian house, especially one that a member of a royal family or person of high social rank used to live in: He rents a flat in a former palazzo on a quiet Venetian canal. Via Garibaldi is lined with stunning 16th-century palazzos. the palazzi, churches, and towers of Siena
More examplesFewer examplesThe Prince walks through the shaded four-acre gardens of his palazzo.We stayed in a crumbling palazzo in a remote part of Tuscany.These old palazzos are often used as museums and exhibition centres.
